net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller

Class DocumentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller.DocumentManager

  • public class DocumentManager
extends Object

    A helper class to access and store the contents of documents obtained from XML files.

    A document manager is a cache that can parse the contents of multiple documents from XML files, and provide easy access to them by their file names. The object structures loaded are called documents and all implement the DocumentProxy interface. Once loaded, they are stored in the cache, so they can be quickly retrieved when needed a second time.

    The caching mechanism provides some protection against modification of external files through third parties. Whenever a document is found in the cache, it is checked whether the external file has been changed after the document was loaded, and if so, it is reloaded from the modified file.

    After creation of a document manager, it must be provided with the appropriate proxy marshaller for each class of documents to be handled. For example: 

       final DocumentManager manager = new DocumentManager();
   final ModuleProxyFactory factory = ModuleElementFactory.getInstance();
   final OperatorTable optable = CompilerOperatorTable.getInstance();
   final JAXBMarshaller<ModuleProxy> marshaller = new JAXBModuleMarshaller(factory, optable);
   manager.registerMarshaller(marshaller);
   manager.registerUnmarshaller(marshaller);
   final File file = new File("myfile.wmod");
   final ModuleProxy module = (ModuleProxy) manager.load(file);
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentManager

        public DocumentManager()
        Creates a new document manager. Initially, the document manager will not support marshalling or unmarshalling of any file types. To be useful, some ProxyMarshaller or ProxyUnmarshaller objects need to be registered using the registerMarshaller() or registerMarshaller() methods.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> DD load(URI uri,
                                          String name,
                                          Class<DD> clazz)
                                   throws WatersUnmarshalException,
                                          IOException
        Loads a document relative to a URI. This methods loads a document with a given name and location, automatically computing the file extension from the expected class.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to be used to resolve the name.
        name - The name of the file without extension. The extension is determined automatically using a ProxyMarshaller.
        clazz - The desired class of the document to be loaded. This is used to identify an appropriate ProxyUnmarshaller.
        Returns:
        The loaded document. This may just be a cached copy, or it may actually be retrieved by reading an external file.
        Throws:
        WatersUnmarshalException - to indicate that parsing the input file has failed for some reason.
        IOException - to indicate that the input file could not be opened or read.
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyUnmarshaller for the given class was found.

      • load

        public DocumentProxy load(URI uri)
                   throws WatersUnmarshalException,
                          IOException
        Loads a document from a URI. This methods loads a document from a given file name, guessing the expected class from the file name extension.
        Parameters:
        uri - A URI specifying the location of the document to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The loaded document. This may be just be a cached copy, or it may actually be retrieved by reading an external file.
        Throws:
        WatersUnmarshalException - to indicate that parsing the input file has failed for some reason.
        IOException - to indicate that the input file could not be opened or read.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        IOException - to indicate that the input file could not be opened or read.
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyUnmarshaller for the given class was found.

        Parameters:

      • hasBeenModified

        public boolean hasBeenModified(URI uri)
                        throws MalformedURLException
        Checks whether a cached document has been modified externally. This method checks whether file for the document, given by its URI, has been modified since it has last been accessed through the document manager. The check is only performed for file URIs, other URIs are assumed never to change their contents, so this method always returns false for them.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the given URI is not a proper URI.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given URI does not represent a document currently in the cache.

      • hasBeenModified

        public boolean hasBeenModified(File filename)
        Checks whether a cached document has been modified externally. This method checks whether the file for the document, given by its file name, has been modified since it has last been accessed through the document manager.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given file name does not represent a document currently in the cache.

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs(DocumentProxy doc,
                   File filename)
            throws WatersMarshalException,
                   IOException
        Saves a document to a file. This methods writes a document to a given file name, using the marshaller appropriate to the document's class. If the file name differs from the document's current location, the document manager cache will be updated to reflect the name change.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document to be written.
        filename - The absolute path of the file to be written.
        Throws:
        WatersMarshalException - to indicate a failure while writing the data structures.
        IOException - to indicate that the output file could not be opened or written.
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyMarshaller for the given class was found.

      • newDocument

        public void newDocument(DocumentProxy doc)
        Adds a new document to this document manager. This method adds the given document to the cache maintained by the document manager, under the location given by the document. It does not make any attempt to save the document to disk. If the document manager has already stored a document at the given location, the new document will replace the existing one.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document to be added. It should provide a valid file location where the document can be looked up and saved.

      • remove

        public void remove(URI uri)
        Removes a document from the cache. This method removes any cached document for the given URI, in order to save some memory.

      • resolve

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> URI resolve(DocumentProxy context,
                                              String base,
                                              Class<DD> clazz)
                                       throws WatersUnmarshalException
        Determines a full URI for a given document name relative to another document. For example, this method can be used to locate the files for InstanceProxy items found within a module.
        Parameters:
        context - The document containing the name to be looked up.
        base - The name of the document to be looked up.
        clazz - The expected class of the document to be looked up.
        Throws:
        WatersUnmarshalException

      • registerMarshaller

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> void registerMarshaller(ProxyMarshaller<DD> marshaller)
        Registers a proxy marshaller.
        Parameters:
        marshaller - The proxy marshaller to be registered.

      • registerUnmarshaller

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> void registerUnmarshaller(ProxyUnmarshaller<DD> unmarshaller)
        Registers a proxy unmarshaller. This method registers the given unmarshaller object with this document manager, so future calls to the load() method can use it to load documents of the type supported by it.
        Parameters:
        unmarshaller - The proxy unmarshaller to be registered.

      • findProxyMarshaller

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> ProxyMarshaller<DD> findProxyMarshaller(Class<DD> clazz)
        Gets the marshaller used to marshal objects of a given class. If there is no marshaller for exactly the given class, this method tries all superclasses and superinterfaces and returns a marshaller for the first supported class or interface found.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of objects to be looked up.
        Returns:
        The ProxyMarshaller used by this document manager to handle objects of the given class.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyMarshaller for the given class was found.

      • findProxyMarshaller

        public ProxyMarshaller<? extends DocumentProxy> findProxyMarshaller(FileFilter filter)
        Searches for a marshaller that uses the given file filter as its default file filter. This method can be used to choose a marshaller based on the file extension selected by the user in a file dialog, provided that the dialog is set up using file filters obtained from this document manager.
        Parameters:
        filter - The file filter to search for.
        Returns:
        The first ProxyMarshaller that uses the given file filter as its default file filter, using object identity to test for equality.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyMarshaller using the given file filter as default has been found.

      • findProxyUnmarshallers

        public <DD extends DocumentProxy> Collection<ProxyUnmarshaller<? extends DD>> findProxyUnmarshallers(Class<DD> clazz)
        Gets the unmarshaller used to unmarshal objects of a given class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of objects to be looked up.
        Returns:
        A list of ProxyUnmarshaller objects used by this document manager to handle objects of the given class.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - to indicate that no registered ProxyUnmarshaller for the given class was found.

        public List<FileFilter> getSupportedFileFilters()
